member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Cookies.SitefinityCookieAuthenticationOptions.TicketDataFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the Ticket Data Format. The TicketDataFormat is used to protect and unprotect the identity and other properties which are stored in the cookie value. If it is not provided a default data handler is created using the data protection service contained in the IAppBuilder.Properties. The default data protection service is based on machine key when running on ASP.NET, and on DPAPI when running in a different process.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Cookies.SitefinityCookieAuthenticationOptions.SystemClock
member.summary: Gets or sets the System Clock. The SystemClock provides access to the system's current time coordinates. If it is not provided a default instance is used which calls DateTimeOffset.UtcNow. This is typically not replaced except for unit testing.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Cookies.SitefinityCookieAuthenticationOptions.CookieManager

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Cookies.SitefinityCookieAuthenticationOptions.SessionStore
member.summary: Gets or sets the Session Store. An optional container in which to store the identity across requests. When used, only a session identifier is sent to the client. This can be used to mitigate potential problems with very large identities.

member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Tokens.ICustomAccessTokenValidator
member.summary: Custom token validators are developer provided code to authorize requests containing tokens from third party identity providers. These tokens are exchanged for sitefinity access tokens if successful validation occurs. Sitefinity must also be integrated with these identity providers and the external users for which the third party access token was issued should have logged in at least once in Sitefinity in order for a local correlating user account to have been created for them. Or in some circumstances the validation logic could create one such account if the use case permits. That local user account is used to be issued an access token from Sitefinity.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Authentication.Tokens.ICustomAccessTokenValidator.TryAuthenticateWithCustomToken(Microsoft.Owin.IOwinContext)
member.summary: Validates the request and returns the local user account for the third party token.
member.returns: An object containing information about the token and the user. Null if unsuccessful.
